alert.note: Alert for Benewah (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 04 at 10:42PM MDT until May 10 at 12:58PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Spokane WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Idaho... St Joe River at St Maries affecting Benewah County. For the St. Joe River...including Calder, St Maries...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON TO LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...St Joe River at St Maries. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon to late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, Water will be up to Aqua Avenue in St Maries near Leeve hill and walking trail. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM PDT Thursday the stage was 32.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 31.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 34.1 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 32.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday afternoon at 1200 PM PDT.
